text:
Today, many content management systems using propietary repositories and
propietary APIs for repository access.
 
The JSR 170 defines a Content Repository for the Java technology API.
The main goal is the compatibility/interoperability between different content
repositories and a standard API to access repositories.

http://www.jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=170
http://jcr.day.com/

Another interesting JSR in this context:
http://www.jcp.org/jsr/detail/147.jsp (Workspace Versioning and Configuration
Management)
creator: thg@lycos.com
andreas@apache.org
text:
With "compatibility", do you mean that a Lenya content repository should be
accessible using the JSR 170 API? Or do you mean that Lenya should be able to
access JSR 170 repositories?

Both. This (the interoperability between repositories; not CMS) is one of the
main targets of JSR 170. Lenya should handle JSR170 compatible repositories, not
"a" Lenya repository.
creator: thg@lycos.com
andreas@apache.org
text:
That's a tempting idea, but also an extremely ambitious one. IMO a generic JCR
approach would increase the complexity of the codebase beyond maintainability.
It would require a configurable layer to map the semantics of the CMS to the
syntax of the JCR repository.
JCR integration is a goal for the next version of Lenya. Modification of Lenya 2.x to have proper support for JCR will not happen at this time. Thank you for your submission.
creator: rfrovarp@apache.org
